string-array.name: opisy_grzybow
string-array.item: Boletus edulis (Boletus edulis Bull.) - a species of fungi from the boletus family (Boletaceae) [3], colloquially called a bolete. It is found in North America (mainly west of the Rocky Mountains, less common in the central and eastern parts of the continent) and in Europe [4]. Moreover, it was brought to New Zealand [5] i southern Africa [6].

Common mushroom (Agaricus bisporus (J.E. Lange) Imbach) - a species of mushrooms from the mushroom family (Agaricaceae) [1]. It grows wild, but is also widely grown in mushroom farms and sold in shops [2].
The red fly agaric (Amanita muscaria (L.) Lam.) - a species of fungi belonging to the toadstool family (Amanitaceae) [1].
